I am using the dropdowns in the web UI, and the spelling is correct
there, =
so this doesn't seem to be the issue.

A related issue that I discovered to=
day is that the similar filter
defined on the Writer doesn't seem to have a=
ny effect after I dropped
the midfetch filter. The GIFs are still written t=
o the ARC files. The
relevant section of order.xml looks like this:

<map n=
ame=3D"write-processors">
      <newObject name=3D"Archiver"
class=3D"org.a=
rchive.crawler.writer.ARCWriterProcessor">
        <boolean name=3D"enabled=
">true</boolean>
        <map name=3D"filters">
          <newObject name=
=3D"NoImages"
class=3D"org.archive.crawler.filter.ContentTypeRegExpFilter">=

            <boolean name=3D"enabled">true</boolean>
            <boolean =
name=3D"if-match-return">true</boolean>
            <string name=3D"regexp"=
>(?i)image/.*</string>
          </newObject>
        </map>

Any suggestio=
n would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks,
Franck

--- In archive-crawler@yah=
oogroups.com, "Adam Fisk" <adamfisk@...> wrote:
>
> I know "ContentTypeRegE=
xFilter" should be "ContentTypeRegExpFilter" -- 
> it was mispelled on Tree=
's blog if I remember correctly.
> 
> I assume this isn't your problem, but=
 given I don't know anything 
> about how you're running your crawl, I thou=
ght I'd throw it out there.

> -Adam
